channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: My first blog post
item.description: Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON = "/Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/bin/python") reticulate::py_config() ## python: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/bin/python ## libpython: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/lib/libpython3.8.dylib ## pythonhome: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use:/Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use ## version: 3.8.12 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Oct 12 2021, 21:21:17) [Clang 11.1.0 ] ## numpy: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy ## numpy_version: 1.21.4 ## ## NOTE: Python version was forced by RETICULATE_PYTHON library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(dose=c("D0.5", "D1", "D2"), len=c(4.2, 10, 29.5)) ggplot(data=df, aes(x=dose, y=len, group=1)) + geom_line()+ geom_point() import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # x axis values x = [1,2,3] # corresponding y axis values y = [2,4,1] # plotting the points plt.

item.title: My first blog post
item.description: Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON = "/Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/bin/python") reticulate::py_config() ## python: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/bin/python ## libpython: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/lib/libpython3.8.dylib ## pythonhome: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use:/Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use ## version: 3.8.12 | packaged by conda-forge | (default, Oct 12 2021, 21:21:17) [Clang 11.1.0 ] ## numpy: /Users/lrabalski1/miniforge3/envs/everyday_use/lib/python3.8/site-packages/numpy ## numpy_version: 1.21.4 ## ## NOTE: Python version was forced by RETICULATE_PYTHON library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(dose=c("D0.5", "D1", "D2"), len=c(4.2, 10, 29.5)) ggplot(data=df, aes(x=dose, y=len, group=1)) + geom_line()+ geom_point() import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # x axis values x = [1,2,3] # corresponding y axis values y = [2,4,1] # plotting the points plt.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
